fields.description:
{{Original summary: Dots in Kanban cards considering weekends even when they are not selected on ‘Working Days’}}

It would be interesting to have the dots in Kanban boards reflecting the configuration set on ‘Working Days’ settings.

Currently, even if users uncheck Saturday and Sunday on their boards, the amount of dots displayed on the cards disregards this setting and the total days in a column will consider a 7 days week.

_Noticed on Cloud instances: JIRA Agile v6.6.70-D20150216T131212_
fields.summary: Days in column indicator dots should respect non-working days for the board

fields.description: I believe we should have a documentation to explain to customers why Story Points on sub-tasks are currently not being counted towards the Burndown Chart. The lack of pages containing this information can be reason of doubt from our customers.
fields.summary: Clarification for Burndown chart not counting Story Points on Sub tasks

fields.description:
As a scrum master I would like to be able to apply boundary dates for sprints that have not yet started so that I can schedule upcoming sprints

Acceptance Criteria
* I can apply sprint start date for sprints not yet started
* I can apply sprint end date for sprints not yet started
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would like to be able to apply boundary dates for sprints that have not yet started

fields.description: Be able to create pages, Stand-up notes, etc., and have links to them on the Board for Kanban but on the Sprint for Scrum. For Scrum having it be per Sprint would even be more useful.
fields.summary: As a board manager I want to be able to create and link Conflunce pages to a Board.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11838].
  {panel}

h3. *Steps to Reproduce* 
# Created three custom fields *Text Field (Multi-line)* set the *Renderers: Wiki Style Renderer*
# Associated the custom fields to the Project 
# Open the Jira Agile Board, Click *Create (in the top Navigation Bar)*
# Fill in the custom fields *Text Field (Multi-line)* 
# Getting an error:
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Observations*
# Not getting the error when the Custom Field Renderers is *Default Text Renderer*
# Not getting the error when you Create issue, by accesing the Jira Agile Board then *right click Create(in the top Navigation Bar) then Open Link in a New Tab*

h3. *Workaround*
Create issue by accessing the Jira Agile Board then *right click Create(in the top Navigation Bar) then Open Link in a New Tab*
fields.summary: Getting Script error when creating issue in Agile Board View with a Project that has more than two Text Field (multi-line) Custom Field

fields.description:
# Have a board which looks at multiple projects
# Have epics from multiple projects (let's say "Project 1" and "Project 2")
# Drag an issue which is in "Project 1" to an "Project 2" epic
# You won't be allowed to change the epic
fields.summary: Unable to change epic to and epic from a different projet in board with multiple project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11835].
  {panel}

If the user opens the _board_ then clicks on _backlog_ (left menu), he will see the option _versions_. These versions can be edited, however when the user selects a new Release Date on the calendar, the field isn't updated.
Please check the following video:
- [^Date picker.mp4]

The same issue occurs while using the project's navigation sidebar.

*Workaround:* 
- Access the administration of the project
- Click on Versions
- There it's possible to edit the dates
fields.summary: Release date and start date cannot be changed on Agile Board
Agile reports should adjust historical data in the reports reflecting the changes in JIRA workflow
Basic Search Support for the Epic Link field

fields.description:
Boards can be created by anyone in JIRA. In the case where the project associated to that board is deleted, then the board filter would have no shares. Thus, only the owner of that board can view it. What happens when the users delete the project is that the filter will be removed from the _sharepermissions_ table, thus the filter will be marked as No Shares. However, the filter is still listed in _searchrequest_ table.

There is no feature to allow admin to have access to the private-filtered boards. Not even from REST API. Not being able to enumerate all boards using the REST-API prevents the admin from cleaning up the boards automatically while this can be a must in some companies environment.

This is a very crucial ability that the admin should have. Imagine when for performance reasons, the user needs to split their big instance with 1000 projects twice into 3 instances with 400 - 400 - 200 projects. They do this by cloning the instances and deleting the projects that do not belong to the new instance. However, when the boards are deleted, then the admin will not have the access to the boards anymore. Not even for cleaning up purposes.
fields.summary: JIRA System Administrator should have ADMIN right in every board created even when filter is not shared

fields.description:
Right now, when I grab an issue on an agile board, the columns I am allowed to drag it to have dotted boxes appear. If there is more than one status allowed in a particular column, several dotted boxes with the status names appear in that column. If there is only one allowed status in a column, no name/label appears in the dotted box.

I think the status name should appear in the dotted box, anyway. This makes it extra clear what status the issue would change to. This could resolve issues that might arise where the name of the column is not a good indicator of the allowed status in that column.
fields.summary: Not all columns on an Agile board list the actual states allowed to be dragged into

fields.description:
As a team member
I want an easy (one or two click) way to mark an issue as Blocked / At Risk / Going Back on our board
So I can quickly communicate a precise status to our team.

On our physical board we used to use a sticky to indicate a story was blocked, turn it to an angle to indicate "at risk", and turn it upside down to indicate it would not be completed.  We are currently using the Flag to indicate that one of those 3 is the case.  It would be great to be able to flag stories with more detail (different colors / type of flag, one click for a label, etc.).
fields.summary: Easy to use multi-state visual indicator for Agile Work mode

fields.description:
As a Product Owner 
I would like a hotkey for the Backlog Search in Agile Plan mode
So that I can search for stories with less switching between a keyboard and mouse.
fields.summary: Hotkey for the Backlog Search in Agile Plan mode

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce* 
# Create a Test Filter, Created a Test JIRA Agile Board
# Copy the Agile Board 
#* It created a *Copy of the Board* but it uses the original filter instead of creating a copy of the filter
!Board.png|thumbnail!
# Deleting the Copy of the Board will delete the orginal filter 

*Expected Results*
If you copy a JIRA Agile Board it should create a copy of it and a copy of the associated filter. Deleting the copied filter should not delete the original filter. 

*Actual Results*
If you copy a JIRA Agile Board it's creating a copy of the board and does not copy the filter associated to the board
fields.summary: In copying Agile Board, it doesn't create a copy of the associated Filter

fields.description:
As a board user I would like to be able to quickly change the Swimlane configuration without having to go into the board configuration screens.  Just offering the more simple choices would be good, Epics, Assignee, Etc., leaving our JQL would be fine.

We like to have the Swimlanes by Stories most of the time and then use quick filters to show issues for a particular user. However it would be more useful if you could just switch to By Assignee or Epics more quickly.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to change the Swimlane type  on the board itself

fields.description:
Provide an option to users to skip create new issue popup entirely if the board doesn't have any issue in backlog.

Currently, every users will be prompted with create issue screen whenever they try to access an Agile board without any issue in backlog. Not all users will have new issue to create.

This also affecting the new project centric navigation - browsing an Agile project will give the same popup.
fields.summary: Provide an option to users to skip create new issue popup entirely if the board doesn't have any issue in backlog

fields.description:
We use Sub-tasks & Defects (a Sub-task Issue Type) to assign work instead of assigning people to a Story which is really owned by the Team.
We organize our Agile Board Work View with Swimlanes for Epics and use the prioritization of the Epics to determine priority within the currently running Sprint.
Epics contain Stories which contain Sub-tasks & Defects which are then assigned to users.

However, during our Daily Stand Up, when we use a filter to see what work someone has the filter hides the Stories (as we intend) to which the Sub-tasks & Defects belong, but all of the Sub-tasks & Defects then show in the "Issues without Epics" Swimlane instead of the Swimlane to which their containing Story is a part.
fields.summary: Filtered Sub-tasks should not appear in "Issues without Epics" in Agile Board Work View

fields.description: It would be useful to have a count of the number of issues in each swim lane in the Agile view.
fields.summary: Add issue count to Sprint swimlane header

fields.description:
When watching or unwatching an issue in an Agile board the page reloads. This should not happen.

Occurs when using issue action in Detail View and when using dot dialog.
fields.summary: Watching an issue should not reload the Agile board

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce:
Go to any agile board which the user has administrate project.
Go to any version, right click, edit name
Change the name to anything else.  Observe all the tickets in the middle panel get updated to the new name
Hit reload.

h1. Expected behavior
All the tickets are  have a lozenge that says that they are of version (altered version)

h1. Observed behavior
All the tickets are still in the (original version)

This has been independently verified by [~twong]


h1. Troubleshooting notes
(verified by [~twong]
1. Not a race condition: we waited for a while between each change.  (Theory was it could have been a lucene update thing)
2. No js errors are reported in the console at all when you do ths.
3. No errors in the atlassian-jira.log when it happens.
4. It seems to fail about 60% of the time:  Sometimes the change goes through.
5. Not a permissions error.  The user in question is in the administrate project role, and we double checked with the jira-administrator user also.
6. This seems to happen on every board.
7. This is reproducible on UAT.

JIRA Agile Plugin : 6.6.41
JDK 8u20
fields.summary: Changing the name of a version in the agile board does not always persist the change

fields.description:
I want to import a png (234ko) and the system answers me "Internal error".

I cannot send you attachment cause I got the same error on your system.

I'm blocked by this issue, please fix it asap.
fields.summary: Cannot import attachment

fields.description:
We have an increasing number of boards created by anyone among our  7000+ users. This has a big bad impact on Jira performance. Now at 1100 boards we still are in a good position to find and remove obsolete inactive boards but we see a tendency that creating boards is getting out of hand in a near future.

We suggest that only Project Administrators should have the permission to create a board.
Also we suggest that the naming field when copying a board should be empty and not state "Copy of...". This will force the board to the proper naming.

Also I suggest that when a Project Administrator creates a new board it should be "Private" by default which would mean that it should not show for all other Project Administrators unless it is shared to a specific group/role or project (just the same way as when creating a filter).

We had the same problem with stuctures created by anyone when we installed the Structure plugin. We suggested the same permission change to ALM Works and they implemented this in the next release which was a very good solution.
fields.summary: Permission scope for creating Agile boards
First Project

fields.description: Currently, the sprint dropdown box shows all sprints for all projects.  It would be a real improvement if these sprints in the dropdown were limited only to sprints containing issues for the current project you are creating the story for.
fields.summary: Limit sprints in sprint dropdown when creating story to only show sprints for the current project.

fields.description: Allow being alerted when an issue moves from one sprint to another.
fields.summary: Alert when moving to another sprint

fields.description:
Original summary: {{As a Scrum Board user I'd like to see the Epic assigned to the story in Work mode (story swimlanes)}}

Currently the Work mode's Story swimlane setup only shows the key +  summary, but it would be useful to see the assigned Epic also. Users would have a better view on the sprint if the affected epic would be shown on the stories.
fields.summary: Epic link label visible on story in Active sprints (Work mode) when using story swimlanes

fields.description:
After the recent UI changes, the arrows to expand an Sprint are not clickable, depending on the scroll position.
It seems that there are other layout elements overlapping the arrows.
In the attached screenshot, the arrow is not clickable when in this position. if I scrollup (move the arrow down), then I can click it.
As you can see in the bug2.png attached, chrome developer tools identifies a div above the arrow.
fields.summary: Cannot expand Sprint after UI changes

fields.description:
Found when a new Kanban Board is created, a sub-filter of {{fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY}} is added to the Kanban Board configuration.  This sub-filter may not be needed in some scenarios.  

This causes Issues to not display on the Kanban board if the Issues are not configured with a _fixVersion_ field. 

Customers should be able to add in their own sub-filters (if necessary) to their Kanban boards. 

*Workaround*
Remove filter
fields.summary: No Sub-Filter on New Kanban Board Creation

fields.description:
In previous versions of JIRA Agile, projects were created based on the Default screen scheme, as the image below:
!Screen Shot 2015-02-26 at 6.22.05 PM.png|thumbnail!

As of now, JIRA Agile creates separate schemes for each project and a different scheme for the bug issue type, this new screens do not possess the Time Tracking field also, which prevents customers from adding values on the issue creation.
!Screen Shot 2015-02-26 at 6.22.19 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to add time tracking fields to new Agile projects by default

fields.description:
Agile Boards can now be configured to display custom fields as well as other system fields via the Board Configuration.

However Development panel information can not be added yet. This can only be seen in the Detail view.
fields.summary: Add Ability to add Development panel information to Card View

fields.description:
This bug renders the Scrum Planning View useless if the board is based on JQL filter that filters out certain issueTypes.

*How to reproduce*

# Create a new saved filter:  project = <your project> and (NOT (issuetype = Task)) ORDER BY Rank ASC
# Create a new scrum board based on this filter
# Go to that scrum board planning screen
# Create a new issue by using in-line creation field at the bottom of the issues list
# Expected: you can choose between ALL issue types (maybe except the Tasks, as they are filtered out from the board)
# Actual: you can create ONLY Tasks


*Workaround:*
Change the filter to *project = <your project> and issuetype != Task ORDER BY Rank ASC*
fields.summary: Impossible to use Scrum Board planning view to create issues if the board is based on JQL filter that excludes any issue types

fields.description:
So in a kanban view, I generally comment on tickets since im working on several at once. However before the last agile upgrade (as of today its the latest version), the comment button would work for a little while then after a couple of hours, clicking the button would open up "create issue" screen. Refreshing the page would fix it for another 2 or so hours.

With the latest agile plugin, its now create plugin all the time. This affects firefox (v35), chromium and just checked on another machine, chrome.
fields.summary: comment button in kanban view opens "create issue"

fields.description:
Create issue auto-popup in Agile Backlog can't be closed properly, blocking the usage.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 projects with JIRA Default Schemes template
# Create 1 issue in each projects
# Close the issues
# Create Scrum Board for existing projects and select the 2 projects
# Go to the scrum board *Backlog*
# The board will prompt user to create new issue
# Click on Cancel and the board will stay greyed out

h4. Workaround
Press *Esc* button on keyboard and that should get rid of the problem.
fields.summary: Create issue auto-popup in Agile Backlog can't be closed properly, blocking the usage

fields.description:
In earlier "classic" charts, you were able to see both the burndown of hours and the increase in business value in a single chart.
To achieve a similar functionality nowadays you have to create *two* agile boards with the same filter, one set to track in hours and one in business value, then put the resulting burndown gadgets side by side in a dashboard. Whew! This is still far from the simpleness of what we had before.

If the new burndown chart could superimpose the burndown of hours and the increase in either business value or story points (as bar a bar chart perhaps?) we would have a very elegant view of the overall progress.

Competitors do that already and people switching to JIRA Agile are dissapointed by the burndown chart as a result.
fields.summary: Combine Estimation Statistic and Time Tracking on the burndown chart

fields.description:
h4. Replication
# Login as a user without Bulk Change permissions on Global Permissions in JIRA
# Go to Agile board
# Select a few issues.
# Right-click and select Bulk Change
# Select Edit Issues, click Next.
# Scroll down to Change Labels and enter "test" label.
# Scroll to bottom, un-check Send mail for this update, and click Next.
# Confirm change.
# Receive 404 error.

h4. Expected Behaviour
# Bulk Change should not be visible to the user if they do not have permissions
# Otherwise, error should at least say they don't have permission rather than just a 404.

h4. Work around
Perform a search in the issue navigator for those issues and perform a bulk change
fields.summary: Bulk change in Agile without permissions produces 404 error

fields.description:
The agile board (backlog) states "This is a sprint. Plan a sprint by dragging issues here." on empty sprint (see the attachment).
I can't help to notice that the "This is a sprint." part is utterly unneccessary and is even a little amusing.
fields.summary: Agile board empty scrum sprint

fields.description:
We have a dashboard that uses the Agile Sprint Health Gadget, which shows our story points grouped by todo/in progress/complete status. The chart is accurate, but when we click on a status (eg, in progress), we are taken to a page that contains an empty list of stories (see attachments).

If it helps to reproduce, this can be reproduced using the eBusiness Team Dashboard at xpedxit.atlassian.net.
fields.summary: Dashboard gadget link to in list of stories does not work

fields.description:
With JIRA Agile 6.6.60 installed and the sidebar enabled, JIRA Agile boards throw the following exception when navigating to the *Backlog* and *Active Sprints* areas of the board:
!AgileBoardError.png|thumbnail!

{noformat}An error occurredHide…

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details

        Exception: TypeError: JIRA.API.Sidebar.getAUISidebar is not a function
        Resource: http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true
        Line: 7075
        Column: 1919

Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.9; rv:35.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/35.0
Stack trace

    f.prototype.reactToSidebarSizeChange@http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true:7075:1920
    GH.RapidBoard.ViewController.initModes@http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true:7073:2811
    GH.RapidBoard.ViewController.init@http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true:7073:1471
    GH.RapidBoard.initListeners@http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true:2496:2518
    GH.RapidBoard.init@http://localhost:8080/s/546b9de98d3aa1c9e2680901d4dc3ffe-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/2691cb375cef6d15bf0df651cee1eb4b/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general,jira.project.sidebar,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-US&jag_disabled_marketing=true:2496:3099
    d.Callbacks/j@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:40:215
    d.Callbacks/o.fireWith@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:42:6
    .ready@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:30:43
    P@http://localhost:8080/s/85c680c989d438ccdb6dc754a6595184-CDN/en_USpschfx/64012/4/3/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-US:39:184{noformat}

(i) This is reproducible on a fresh installation of JIRA EAP v6.4m14 with JIRA Agile v6.6.60.

*Workaround*

Please disable the Sidebar Dark Feature by:
# Navigating to JIRA with this address http://YOUR.JIRA.COM/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
# Disable this Dark Feature {{com.atlassian.jira.projects.ProjectCentricNavigation}}

If the problem remains after removing the dark feature, some users may have opted to use the new Navigation mode through a banner suggestion, so we'll need to remove their opt-in directly from the database with the following steps:
# (!) Create a backup of JIRA's database or an XML Backup from JIRA
# Shutdown JIRA
# Run the following query in JIRA's database:
{code:sql}DELETE FROM feature WHERE FEATURE_NAME like '%ProjectCentricNavigation%';{code}
# Start JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA.API.Sidebar.getAUISidebar is not a function loading Agile boards with sidebar enabled

fields.description:
Whenever we come across a previously unknown bug that holds up a user story, we pop a bright pink sticky note on our scrum board. Currently I enter this as a new sub-task in JIRA with "BUG: " as the first few characters of the summary. It  would be extremely useful to have a separate type of sub-task that identifies this as being a problem instead of just a sub-task with a different summary.

Unless I've missed something, I don't believe that this functionality is currently available.

Many thanks.
fields.summary: Bugs as sub-tasks

fields.description:
Today I make one Kanban Board to see all projects in our organization using JQL queries in the swimlanes - this is manual and needs frequent updates. Unfortunately it doesn't scale. I work in an organization with 5,000 employees (500 teams) and am looking for a single automated view where each week I don't have to tweak swim lanes. 

Examples:
Swimlane 1: project = ABC
Swimlane 2: project = XYZ
Swimlane 3: project = 123
etc

In addition it would be great to say all projects (grouped in swim lanes) where issues match certain criteria (eg a label called "efficiency") so I can get a view, across all teams, grouped by team, of the issues across the company working to improve efficiency.

More at (along with other customers requesting):
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/223061/answers/4050221/comments/12281173

Many thanks!
fields.summary: Group issues in JIRA Agile swimlanes automatically (no manual JQL updates continually)

fields.description:
According to [GHS-6072|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6072], the current behaviour for JIRA Agile enabled projects is for sub-tasks to inherit the parent issue Fix Version - This is currently not documented anywhere.

I believe we could update the [Adding an Issue to a Version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Adding+an+Issue+to+a+Version] document to include this observation.
fields.summary: We should update our documentation regarding versions and sub-tasks

fields.description: Currently, if you print the view board - it does not render correctly.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to print the Rapid View board
Sprint table is refering to a deleted board id

fields.description:
After adding fields via card layout, for example estimated effort, due date, and assignee, it would be helpful to edit the values directly on the card on the board. So the user could click on the date and a datetime picker appears, users could click on the time and a text box is activated to change the value. This behavior could be extended to any field added to the card fronts via the card layout screen. This would save considerable time when editing single values for issues, rather than having to click on the card, clicking the ... on the right, clicking edit issue and then clicking update issue.

I've attached an interactive pdf to try and demonstrate the concept more clearly.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to edit items on cards directly

fields.description: When you close an issue, the key is crossed out. When you re-open it, you would expect for the line will be removed, but it is still crossed out.
fields.summary: Re-Opened Issues are still crossed out

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to be able to log/record the number of story points that I have spent to work on a a specific story. Just like how Original Estimate allows logging work.
fields.summary: Log Story Points

fields.description:
At the moment, when Scrum boards have overlapped filter, simultanuously activating sprints in those boards (having the overlapped filters) will cause multiple active sprints in a board.

BOARD A filter: *project = "PROJECT A " ORDER BY Rank ASC*
BOARD B filter: *project = "PROJECT B" OR project = "PROJECT A " ORDER BY Rank ASC*

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Open the boards separately
# Create sprint in both boards
# Start sprint in BOARD A
# Start sprint in BOARD B

h5. Results:
# Both sprint will be started
# Later Board B will have 2 active sprints

h5. Suggestion:
- What we expect is for Board B to detect the *latest status of itself* (whether there is another active sprint which just get started or not) when the user tries to start a sprint, without having to manually refresh the page. 
- Because JIRA Agile is used by different teams in a company. We can't expect the users to manually refresh the page before they click on *start sprint*. Different teams might start their own sprints simultaneously. And this will lead to having multiple active sprints in a board (with overlap filter).

h5. Workaround
- User should avoid having overlapped filter.
- User should refresh the page before starting the sprint to avoid having more than 1 active sprints.
fields.summary: Simultaneously activating multiple sprints in a board Should not lead to having multiple active sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11775].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Time-out errors when releasing a large amount of issues from a Kanban board

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a board with >100 unreleased issues;
# click *Release...*;
# fill in the required fields in the dialog displayed and click *Release*.

h3. Expected Results
Issues are released and new *Version* is created.


h3. Actual Results
The release takes a long time due to the number of issues and a time-out error is displayed.

h3. Notes
The error is only at the UI level, though, and the operation continues in the back end. The new Version is created and released, and all issues are updated as expected. Refreshing the board will confirm that - released issues are no longer visible.

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the board should confirm that released issues are no longer visible.

(i) Ensure the board is set to filter out issues that already have a released fixVersion set by configuring the _Kanban board sub-filter_ with:
{code:borderStyle=solid} 
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{code}
fields.summary: Timeout errors when releasing a large amount of issues from a Kanban board

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to be able to export the logged work per Sprint and be able to sort them per status in accordance to the logged work.
fields.summary: Export Log Work per Sprint

fields.description:
Given that I am a registered JIRA User
And I am using JIRA Agile Scrum
When I add a story to a sprint
And then I change the story point value
Then the sprint plan view shows that the total number of points in the sprint is 
equal to the sum of the CURRENT value of the story points
This is the correct and expected outcome

Given that I am a registered JIRA User
And I am using JIRA Agile Scrum
And I add a story to a sprint
And then I change the story point value
When I close the sprint
Then the velocity in the sprint reports is equal to the sum of the INITIAL value of the stories at the time they were added to the sprint.
This is inconsistent, incorrect and an unexpected outcome that causes the sprint velocity reports to be useless.
fields.summary: Velocity Count is wrong in Sprint Reports

fields.description:
A common workflow for us is it create a high-level story that may affect multiple components. As we get closer to a sprint where the work will actually be done, the story may get split into multiple smaller stories for each component. We currently use the clone feature to do this which has the benefit of creating links between the different stories.

The biggest frustration with that method is that when we clone a ticket, it is created either at the bottom of the backlog or the bottom of the current sprint (depending on where the originating ticket is). When the backlog is large, it is frustrating and time consuming to drag the issue back to its correct space. It'd be very nice if the newly cloned issue were inserted in the same place as the original.
fields.summary: When cloning issues, clone the position in the backlog

fields.description:
Via
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/8+February+2015+to+13+February+2015?focusedCommentId=714014952#comment-714014952

"The board management functionality is a bit off.  The drop down for the Agile boards already shows your "recent" boards.  Selecting the option to Manage Boards takes you to another page with the default view being "Recently Visited Boards".  You have to select the "All Boards" hyperlink to see the paginated boards (which is the reason you went to that page anyway)"
fields.summary: Selecting Manage boards should take me to a view of "All boards", not recently viewed boards, which is what I was just looking at.

fields.description:
*Current Behaviour*
New sub-tasks on JIRA Agile inherit the *Fix Version/s* field from the parent issue (see [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6072]).

*Current Workaround*
Remove the project from the projects 'Enabled for JIRA Agile' in the JIRA Agile configuration. 

*There is currently no way to disable fix version inheritance for Sub-tasks for JIRA Agile enabled projects.*
It would be great to have the possibility of configuring this behaviour to disable fix version inheritance (e.g. a checkbox on the JAG configuration screen).
fields.summary: It should be possible to configure Fix Version/s field inheritance from parent ticket when creating sub-task

fields.description:
* I have a bookmark to an Agile Board in Chrome: https://penskemediacorp.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=3
!2014-07-14_08-50-20.png!
* I have Chrome set up to automatically open this bookmark when I open my browser
!2014-07-14_17-32-17.png!
* Instead, when I open my browser it lands on my default dashboard: https://penskemediacorp.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa
* Clicking on the bookmark works fine.
fields.summary: Agile Board bookmark opens dashboard, instead of Agile board

fields.description:
One of our users is having trouble accessing one of our boards. According to him, the problem started after he was asked to update java after logging on to the site. 

If you need anymore information please let me know.
fields.summary: Script Error stops user from accessing board

fields.description:
Original summary {{Ability to use right-click "Add to Sprint" for issues in a backlog sorted by something other than rank}}

Although it is currently possible to change the filter on a rapid board to show the backlog sorted by something other than "Rank", doing so completely locks the backlog so that you can't change the order OR move backlog issues into the current sprint.

I understand completely why the backlog ranking is locked in this case and am not asking you to change this behaviour.

What I do want is to be able to Right-Click on an issue in the backlog and "Send to Current Sprint".when the board is sorted by anything other than rank.

This would allow me to view and assign issues to the sprint during sprint planning while using a view that is based on my idea of priority (i.e. business value), but would not require any changes to the default rank mechanic.

This simple change would save me hours! Dragging and dropping issues to sort them in a list of several hundred items is just not workable.
fields.summary: Ability to use sprints when backlog not sorted by rank

fields.description:
At the moment, search box in JIRA Agile plan mode is used to search text in the issues. It does not support JQL query. Thus, user cant search based on issue fields. 

At this moment, user can create quick filter and it will appear beside the search box. But it is a hassle to depend on that as they need to either create another quick filter or edit the current quick filter if they want to search based on other certain field.

It would be useful to have that search box to support JQL as well.
fields.summary: Agile search box should support JQL

fields.description:
For a project with a vary team size (ramp-up, ramp-down) or a bigger team it is very inconvinient to limit the max WIP of a lane.
This sounds very mechanic from the automotive industry where the production line has a max. of roboters which you can place along with.

In software engineering discipline I often see junior developers tackling more issues parallel which rather has a slow down effect. (Context switching too much parallel work, a single issue could have been moved on to the review and tester team...)

Therefore I would find it useful to have an option telling the max WIP limit on this lane is 2 per user. So that if I have 8 developers the total max on lane basis would be 16. But I'm guranteed that the junior developers concentrate on finish the tasks the tackle before fetching another one.
fields.summary: Setting kanban WIP limit on user per lane basis and not as total limit on the lane.

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Show Epics from other Projects in Plan Mode}}

As a User i want to be able to see Epics in the left sidebar in Plan Mode, even if these Epics belong to other Projects.

Currently it's a very confusing and inconsistent View, because the Epic-Labels are displayed on the Storys, but not on the left Sidebar.

I do *not* want to adjust my filter to work with multiple projects because i would loose features like simplified workflow which are very important for me.
fields.summary: Show all relevant epics in the epic panel

fields.description:
I work with a geographically dispersed team, many of my team members observe different holiday schedule. 

It would be very hepful to set a non working day schedule on a person by person (or group of persons even better) basis.
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I need to set non-working days on a person by person basis

fields.description:
http://quickstart.atlassian.com/download/jira/ninja-training/jira-ninja/white-belt

This page has broken links for Yellow, Green and Black belts, which point you to the JIRA 101 documentation.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Ninja guide has broken links

fields.description:
To reproduce.

# Go to plan more or work mode
# Select a standard issue that contains sub-tasks
# In the ticket details panel, scroll to the sub-tasks section

The environment I am using is:

- Firefox 35.0.1 (on Windows 7)
- JIRA 6.3.11
- JIRA Agile 6.6.13
- Screen Resolution: 1366 x 768

This appears to happen either when the sub-task's issue key and/or the summary is too long to also fit the status. In plan mode we can resize the panel to accommodate this issue. However we cannot change the size of the detail panel in work mode. This is troublesome as we have a quick filter to show only standard issues and we use the ticket details to scan for the sub-task status.

Perhaps the status could be set beneath the issue key so it is always shown (or allow us to resize the detail panel in work mode).
fields.summary: Status labels of sub-tasks are cut off in the ticket detail panel

fields.description: In the most recent update to cloud, the "Red" epic color has been changed to "Orange". Is there an explanation for the change?
fields.summary: Why Do Epic Colors Keep Changing?

fields.description:
When a user attempts to manage a sprint involving multiple projects without necessary permissions for each project, the error message states that they need Project Administrator permission for each project, rather than just the projects for which they *do not* have permission.

{panel:title=Example}
*Scenario*
- Sprint involves 'Project A', 'Project B', 'Project C'
- 'testuser1' has Project Administrator permission to projects 'Project A' and 'Project B', but *not* 'Project C'

*Current Behavior*
# 'testuser1' attempts to start a sprint
# Resulting error messages displays:
{quote}Error
To update this sprint you must have Project Administrator permissions for all of the following projects: Project A, Project B, Project C.{quote}

*Desired Behavior*
# 'testuser1' attempts to start a sprint
# Resulting error message displays something like:
{quote}Error Managing Sprint
You are missing Project Administrator permissions for the following projects: Project C. Please contact your JIRA Administrator.{quote}
{panel}
fields.summary: Improve Permissions Error Messages for Sprint Management

fields.description:
h6.current behaviour
# Initially, the inline issue creation in Agile board backlog pre-selects the issue type based on the alphabetical order of available types.
# After a user changes the issue type and creates an issue with it, the new default type will be cached in their browser. 
# The new default type is retained until an issue with a different type is created, or the user clears their browsing data.

*Example:* in the applicable Issue Type Scheme, "Task" is the default type, but "Bug" is higher in the alphabetical order. In the inline issue creation, "Bug" will be the default issue type at first. If a user changes it and creates a "Task" though, it will be the default type from then on - until an issue of another type is created. 

h6.suggestion
Initially, the default type from the applicable Issue Type Scheme should be selected in inline issue creation. Afterwards, the type can be determined by previous usage the way it is now.
fields.summary: Inline issue creation should use the default type from the Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Created a new Kanban Board
# Administrators Column is showing the correct User in *JIRA Agile Board Management*
# Change the Username of the user 
# Access the JIRA Agile Board Management, *Administrators* is showing *Anonymous*

*Expected Results*
- JIRA Agile Board Management should show the name of the user in Administrators column

*Actual Results*
- JIRA Agile Board Management is showing *Anonymous* in *Administrators* column for users that have been renamed(username)
fields.summary: JIRA Agile board management showing Anonymous in Administrators column for users that have been renamed(username)

fields.description:
1.Steps to reproduce:
Create kanban board
In column management set "Days in column" to ON
(Show a visual indicator on each card that represents the time spent in the column. This can help identify slow moving issues.)
See how the visual indicator is represented for the newly created issue

2.Expect to happen:
I assume that for newly created issues the indicator should appears as one dot or be empty instead.

3.What happened instead:
For newly created issues visual indicator on Kanban board card that represents the time spent in the column shows -1d and visually appears as an issue that spent many day in the column (a lot of dots)
fields.summary: Wrong visual indicator on Kanban board card that represents the time spent in the column.

fields.description:
*Original Summary*
{{'Kanban board' text displayed as boards title}}

After last Cloud upgrade, when the new sidebar project navigation is enabled, the title on the main frame of a Kanban board is displaying *'Kanban board'*. It used to show the board name.  By Default the navigation Bar is collapsed, the Board Name is is only viewable in expanded view.

It would be good to have the board name back since there is no obvious visual cue as to what board users are viewing if the sidebar is collapsed (board names are only displayed on the sidebar now).

_Noticed on Cloud instances, JIRA Agile v6.6.60-D20150128T011657_
fields.summary: Display the board name - it is not visible when the sidebar is collapsed

fields.description:
When bulk moving issues to a sprint via the Bulk Move mechanism, the Sprint field requires a sprint ID (integer) rather than a sprint Name (string). 

The field should allow for a dynamic dropdown that shows suggestions as you type to allow the user to Bulk Move issues into a sprint via the Sprint Name instead of requiring them to know the Sprint ID (which is hard to find, typically only exposed via the URL scheme), such as when you are editing the Sprint field via the issue Edit mode.
fields.summary: Bulk moving issues should allow Sprint Name instead of Sprint ID

fields.description:
This request stems from the inability to see the same information on a standard issue with sub-tasks as you can on a standard issue without sub-tasks when stories are used as swimlanes. There is an existing request, GHS-5397, to modify this functionality.

In the absence of GHS-5397, an alternative/supplemental solution would be to grey out or otherwise mute issues that are not sub-tasks to the selected parent issue. Our team makes heavy use of sub-tasks and JIRA Agile. However it is difficult to see which sub-tasks are associated with the parent issue at a glance. Especially when there are a large number of issues in the sprint each with their own sub-tasks. This would let you quickly scan the work mode for the status of the sub-tasks without needing to open up the issue details for each one.
fields.summary: When a standard issue is selected in work mode if it has any sub-tasks mute (e.g., grey out) all unrelated issues

fields.description:
Dear Support,

We installed the new version of Jira (6.3.11).

In my scrum board, the epics are not displayed correctly. User stories are always in an epic but the name of the epic is not shown in the Plan view.
In the Work view, when I choose to show swimlanes depending on epics, it doesn't work too.
fields.summary: Epics are not displayed correctly

fields.description:
This will allow us to prioritize which among the stories should be work on first before the others. 
!epic_1.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow story ranking inside an Epic on View Issue page

fields.description:
This one is hard to pin, but I can reproduce it without much effort. 

It seems to have something to do with the amount of issues I choose to bulk-edit. And possibly with the amount of epic issues among the edited. It almost inevitably appears if I have 5+ non-epic issues and one epic, but is much harder to hit if there are 2+ epics in the list
fields.summary: bulk edit allows to set epic link to epic issues... sometimes

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. On the View Issue page, when editing Epic link input existing epic link but with zeroes between prefix and issue number (for example WD-0000009)
2. Move focus out of the field. You'll see the validation message: Epic with key WD-0000009 does not exist
3. Press update button and it guesses the right value

I'm not sure whether it's intended behavior or not, but there seem to be inconsistency in validation process
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior of validation of the Epic Link field

fields.description: Currently several of the teams use the plan view while in demo or retro. Mainly due to the fact that assignee and epics are easily viewable. I have suggested customizing the card in work mode to add these fields. However it would make sense for ease of use to able to complete work in either view.
fields.summary: Ability to complete a sprint in Backlog (plan view)

fields.description:
We would like to know the total number of hours we have spent in a sprint. It would also be great if we can sort this by:
* Whole team
* Per user
fields.summary: Ability to View the Total Amount of Work Spent per Sprint

fields.description:
Название пункта №9 "решение споров" начинается со строчной буквы.  

Steps to reproduce:
1. Открыть браузер.
2. Перейти на сайт: http://isakovktk.wix.com/ta-version-1.
3. Перейти в ниспадающем меню “О центре” к пункту “Публичная оферта”.
4. Найти пункт №9.

Expected result: название пункта №9 должно начинаться с прописной буквы: "Решение споров". Согласно правилам орфографии русского языка слово, которое находится в начале предложения, пишется с прописной буквы.

Actual result: название пункта №9 начинается со строчной буквы: "решение споров".
fields.summary: ID#1 -> «О центре|Публичная оферта» -> «Орфографическая ошибка»

fields.description:
Two failures:
1. Build fails due to obsolete amps configuration in the project
2. After reconfigure amps version, plugin fails to start because required plugin "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license" couldn't be resolved

Current solution:
for 1: Upgrade the amps version configuration in pom.xml to the version installed in build machine
for 2: make "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license" optional by adding com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license;resolution:="optional" to <Import-Package> tag in pom.xml
fields.summary: Jira Marketing Plugin fails to build and startup

fields.description: The Gadgets "Sprint Burndown" and "Sprint Health" allow to specify which sprint to show. However, only active sprints are shown for selection (which is a useless selection, since for one team, we have only one active Sprint). The Gadgets are used to document specific sprints in Confluence (one ConfluencePage per sprint), the currenct behaviour renders the Gadget useless, since the page exhibits a space with an error message, once the sprint is finished (see atached screenshot). It should show the statistics of the selected sprint, even if its finished (like in the sprint report, where finished sprints can be seleted).
fields.summary: Sprint Gadget shall allow specification of closed sprints
As a product owner I would like averages on the velocity chart to assist me during sprint planning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11722].
  {panel}

This is caused by changing JIRA system language after JIRA Agile is installed. It's harmless, but annoying.

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Install JIRA and set system language to German
# Install JIRA Agile -> Agile is installed in German
# Change JIRA system language to English
# The following warnings are seen in the log:
{noformat}
2015-02-02 15:15:50,497 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [manager.issue.fields.CustomFieldContextConfiguratorImpl] Field 'Epos-Status': Option on index '0' was 'Aufgaben' but we expected to be 'To Do'
2015-02-02 15:15:50,544 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [manager.issue.fields.CustomFieldContextConfiguratorImpl] Field 'Epos-Status': Option on index '1' was 'In Arbeit' but we expected to be 'In Progress'
2015-02-02 15:15:50,622 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [manager.issue.fields.CustomFieldContextConfiguratorImpl] Field 'Epos-Status': Option on index '2' was 'Fertig' but we expected to be 'Done'
2015-02-02 15:15:50,700 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [manager.issue.fields.CustomFieldContextConfiguratorImpl] Field 'Epos-Status': Option 'Aufgaben' was default but we expected to be 'To Do'
{noformat}
fields.summary: Eliminate language warnings about JIRA Agile fields

fields.description: As a new JAG user, I would like the ability to backdate previous sprint information into JIRA. This will allow me to use JIRA's charts and estimation functionality much faster. As well as expand the scope of my reporting long term.
fields.summary: Ability to backdate sprint information

fields.description:
*Problem:*
The visual presentation of swimlanes and card colour choices on an Agile board are very personal subjective things, and can have a significant impact on the ease of use for each user. Even within a small team of 4-5 there can be strongly varying preferences, and it makes no sense to impose one view on everyone when working at their own PCs.

*Request:*
For users to be able to personalise their config/view of the Agile Boards for projects they are members of - without changing the config/view for every user in the project. Specifically, the ability to configure card colours & swimlanes for their own custom view, however they prefer.

*Benefit:*
Allowing users to customise their own views of the agile board, would:
- Allow everyone on a team/project to work with their own preferred view.
- Work would be done faster with whichever view they personally find clearest.
- It would also allow admins to spend less time working to reach consensus on something that should be personalisable anyway.
fields.summary: Allow users to personalise their Agile Board View.

fields.description:
Who: Geographically distributed Scrum teams in their daily stand-ups
What: Push of board updates to all browsers open to that board and view
Why: So the stand-up experience is more like standing together in front of a physical board of Post-its.

I'll know this is done when I drag and drop a card in the Planning or Working Board views, and that change appears shortly thereafter on any other device viewing the same board at the same time (my teammates' computer screens/browsers) in at least one flavor of cross-platform browser (such as the latest Chrome).

(Hope I've not created a duplicate; I would've expected this to be a hot issue for those who love JIRA but are stuck using SeeNowDo - slow these days - or Trello - no card hierarchy - but I can't find it in the database. Thanks in advance!)
fields.summary: Push updates of Agile Boards to client displays

fields.description:
In the JIRA Agile Scrum board plan mode, the total story points of stories that are part of current active Sprint and also future Sprints are displayed. 
However, the total story points of the estimated stories in the backlog that do not currently belong to any Sprint is not displayed.
fields.summary: In JIRA Agile Scrum board plan mode, total story points of stories in backlog are not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11715].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
Try accessing <instance-name>.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa with IE 11 (11.0.9600.17416) .

h3.Expected Results:
Webpage shows without errors properly.

h3.Actual Results:
Webpage shows with JavaScript errors.

h3.Workaround:
Use other browsers.

h3.Notes

Here is the error log.

fields.description:
It appears at one point you could do this with Classic charts. I found a previous feature request that was closed as fixed: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-843

However the option is longer available in either classic or rapid.

Customer use case is they have some employees that are color blind and need to modify the color accordingly.
fields.summary: Add ability to adjust color for Burndown charts.

fields.description:
There are at least two scenarios for this bug:

*Preparation for both scenarios*
- Create a new version, a few issues for that version, and estimate all of them
- Create a sprint, and some issues to it, resolve them, and close the sprint. You need at least 4 completed sprints.
 
*Issues not in sprint*

- Create a new sprint (e.g 'Sprint 5'), add a issue to it (e.g KEY-123) and start the sprint
- Resolve an issue from the backlog (e.g. KEY-124). Note that this issue was never in 'Sprint 5'.
- Complete 'Sprint 5'
- Check the Release Burndown report. Both KEY-123 and KEY-124 are listed under 'Sprint 5' (x)

*Issues from another sprint*

- Create a new sprint (e.g. 'Sprint 6'), add an issue to it (e.g. KEY-125) and start the sprint
- Create a new sprint ('Sprint 7'), add an issue to it (KEY-126) but do not start this sprint.
- Resolve the issue KEY-126
- Complete the sprint 'Sprint 6'
- Add some issues to the sprint 'Sprint 7', start it and complete it.
- Check the Release Burndown report. KEY-126 appears in the 'Sprint 6', but if you open it and check the sprint field, it is actually assigned to 'Sprint 7' (x)
fields.summary: Issues completed outside the active sprint appears in the wrong sprint in the Release Burndown report

fields.description:
It would be very beneficial to have a filter/refine option for various confidence intervals (correct term?). 

For instance, what is the cycle time average and median when we're looking at 50% of issues vs 99% of issues? Having a selector would remove the outliers on the upper bound. 

Suggest 75%, 90%, 95%, 99%
fields.summary: Confidence Intervals for Control Chart

fields.description: It would be great to have a search functionality in the Kanban board, in a similar way to what is available for the Plan mode in the Scrum board.
fields.summary: Add search field on "Work" mode for Kanban board

fields.description:
Scenario where this would benifit us.

Our triage process has a kanban board with three columnns.
Awaiting Triage, Clarification Required, Accepted.
It is not acceptable for something to remain in Awaiting Traige column for more than two days.
It is not acceptable for something to remain in Clarification required for more than 5 days.

Right now the 'age' is useful to indicate when something has broken this SLA, however I'd like the ability to make this more 'in your face' by highlighting the card in a bright colour.

Of course the number of days would need to be configurable per column.
fields.summary: kanban board, I want to highlight cards that have remained in a column longer than desired (age greater than x days)

fields.description:
Its not possible to select issues on a kanban board across columns.
Its an issue while using agile cards plugin or trying to do bulk change.

Additionally its not possible to select tasks and sub tasks in one go within the same column. So the behavior is kinda wired..
fields.summary: Allow selection of issues on a kanban board across columns

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a username called _unassigned_
# Create an issue and assign it _unassigned_ user and another issue (leave it _Unassigned_)
# Create a SCRUM/Kanban board
# On JIRA Agile board, click on the issue that is *not* assigned to any user 

*Expected Result:*
- On the card, the _assignee_ should be empty

*Actual Result:*
- On the card, the _assignee_ is the *unassigned* user
fields.summary: Creating a username "unassigned" breaks Lucene Index

fields.description:
Pls add an option to turn-on a feature called e.g. "Show components on cards".

h5. What's it supposed to be doing?
If turned on, the cards on the cardwall (Scrum board, Kanban board) show the component(s) along with the other information shown by default on the cards.

*Note:* We use the Scrum board, but I guess, this would be convenient for Kanban boards, as well. That's why I added Kanban boards - I don't know whether they behave differently.

h5. Why would that be useful?
We are a tools team with more than 20 small tools all managed within the same team and the same iteration. We decided to use 1 project and one component for each of the small tools. That works fine. However, we cannot distinguish cards for one component from cards related to other components. We could use 20 or more swimlanes, but we don't want to do that. We use swimlanes to group according to other semantics - and frankly spoken: Nobody would want to have 20 swimlanes, anyway.
fields.summary: Add option to turn on showing components on cardwall-cards

fields.description:
The Estimation Statistics field in JIRA Agile does not accepts text value. Text or other types can't be recognized by agile in the Estimation Statistics drop down menu.

The suggestion is to let the customer know that it is not possible to choose a value other than a numeric type. As only numeric values can be summed up and it is not applicable for type of text.
fields.summary: It is not possible to pick field type of text for Agile Estimation Statistics
JIRA Agile doesn't handle Renamed Users correctly

fields.description:
In the old design of Project Navigation (Work mode), all active sprints (parallel sprints) are displayed on top of the board next to the board's title. 

In the new design of Project Navigation (Work mode), it shows *All Sprints* button on top of the board and It requires extra clicks to select a particular sprint.

As a user, I would like to see all the active sprints on top of board without having to click *All Sprints* button first.
fields.summary: Display all active sprints in the new project navigation

fields.description:
*+Context+*

Right now users can show All issues, only issues in a visible epic, or only Issues without epics in a Scrum board.

There're chances that an Epic is marked as Done while some issues in it are incomplete. In this case, the incomplete issues are only visible if All issues are shown. For boards with lots of issues, there's no way to filter these issues easily.

(!) Issues without epics won't show these issues because they're actually WITH an epic.

*+Suggestion+*
Create a filter in Epic column which shows Incomplete issues in Done Epics

*+Workaround+*
Using Script Runner, this Quick Filter can be used:
{code}issueFunction in linkedIssuesOf('"Epic Status" = Done','is Epic of'){code}
fields.summary: Create an Epic filter which shows Incomplete issues in Done Epics

fields.description:
In SCRUM board plan mode, only parent issues are visible (not its sub-tasks) and it has to match the board's Saved Filter. Once parent issues are added to a sprint, it will be displayed in Work mode together with its sub-tasks. Below is the scenario:
- the board _Saved Filter_: project = ABC ORDER BY Rank ASC
- Swimlanes: Story
- Make a _quick filter_ to filter issues based on *fixVersion*: fixVersion=1.0
- Assign only the parent issues (not the sub-tasks) with _fixVersion_ = 1.0

*Current Behavior:*
- In the work mode, when users click on the above _Quick Filter_, it will *only* display parent issues (not with its sub-tasks) since the sub-tasks do not contain _fixVersion_. 

*Suggested Behavior:*
- In the work mode, when users click on the above _Quick Filter_, the sub-tasks should be displayed regardless of the *fixVersion* (following its parent issues). The sub-tasks should *not* be included *only* if the sub-tasks contain different *fixVersion* with its parent.
fields.summary: Display all sub-tasks in work mode regardless of "fixVersion"

fields.description:
It would be great if we can have an option to associate the _Release_ button (link) from the Kanban board to a specific transition, so after release a version and add it to the issues, the issues can be closed or go to any other status.

I also thinked about a Listener for that, but seems the Release button is not triggering any specific event.
An event associated to this button can be a good approach as well.
fields.summary: Associate the Release button to a Workflow transition
